content.placeHolder: Type the email address you are writing to

para.text: Use a short, informative subject line.

content.placeHolder: Type the subject of your email

para.text: Start the email with a general greeting and refer to previous emails or meetings.
Thanks for your message—glad to hear you’re settling in OK.
Describe, give information, recommend, persuade, etc.
I had a think about your email and have a couple of suggestions for you. Firstly,
a local place called Mexicana. It’s on Bridge Street and
they sell really cool tacos and burritos
you’ve ever seen, but the food is awesome :)
Another option is Noodles—it’s the cheapest place to get all kinds of Asian dishes. So it’s always
meet up soon and try some places out together? Let me know when you’re free and we can meet up in town.
End the message in an informal way.
Use a closing such as 'All the best' and write your name.

content.placeHolder: Type 'All the best', etc., and your name

steps.label: Why are informal emails written?
desc: Some exams require candidates to write an email that demonstrates the ability to understand a particular situation and respond appropriately using of one or more of the following functions:

steps.label: How is an informal email structured?
desc: Below is the framework that was used to create this email.

steps.label: How does the email start and finish?
desc: You can open with 'Hi' or 'Dear' + the person's first name. End with 'All the best', etc. and your first name.

filters.label: The email opens with a general greeting.
The writer describes some eating places.
The writer makes recommendations and suggestions.
The writer uses a friendly ending.

checkList.text: Use the framework to organize your own email.
Use language for explaining and reporting.
checkList.tellMeMore:
Explaining

I’ve only just got your message.

I’ve been away.

I’ve been out of town (especially NAmE)

Reporting

I spent the weekend down in Devon with Jo.

The weather was glorious.

checkList.text: Use language for recommending, describing and giving information.
checkList.tellMeMore:
Recommending

I'd recommend...

I found the staff at Mexicana really friendly.

Describing

The food is awesome.

They sell really cool tacos.

It's not the smartest place.

It's packed and really noisy.

Giving information

You can get there in three hours by train.

You get the train from London Paddington.

checkList.text: Use language for suggesting and persuading.
checkList.tellMeMore:
Suggesting

Let's...

Why don't we...?

Persuading

Won't you come with us?

It would be great if you came too.

How are you?

How are things?

I hope you're well.

checkList.text: Use an informal style. You can use short forms and incomplete sentences.
You can use emoticons and exclamation marks.

checkList.tellMeMore:
Look forward to meeting up.

Have a good week.

Good luck with your exam.
